parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240040), which is a strong indicator of electoral propaganda, as it's a common identifier used by candidates in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions and promotes "Partidul România în Acțiune" (PRA), identifying it by name.  Elena Condei, the candidate, is also implicitly referenced through the page name and the provided CMF number. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of hashtags further amplifies this reach, targeting potential voters in Giurgiu County and beyond. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support PRA, specifically mentioning their position on the ballot. Phrases like "Votați pentru integritate!", "Alegeți pe cei care vin printre cetățeni", and "Votați Partidul România în Acțiune!" directly aim to influence voting behavior. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It's a clear advocacy piece promoting a specific political party and candidate, not an unbiased presentation of information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content transcends personal opinion; it's a direct call to action urging voters to support a particular party.  While it uses emotionally charged language, this is done strategically to persuade voters, not simply to express a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3263257220484128</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post strongly suggests electoral propaganda.  The presence of a CMF number, explicit party promotion, targeting of a wide audience, and the clear intention to influence voting behavior all point towards a violation.  The post's content goes beyond simply informing voters; it actively advocates for a specific party.  The argument that it's simply encouraging participation in the democratic process is weak, given the direct endorsement of PRA.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Elena Condei</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Kuantero SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 3263257220484128, care promovează Partidul România în Acțiune (PRA) și candidata Elena Condei, folosind fraze precum "Votați Partidul România în Acțiune!", "Votați pentru integritate!", și menționând poziția pe buletinul de vot, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea PRA,  constituind astfel propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.  Prezența numărului CMF 11240040 confirmă natura electorală a postării.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
